verses.roman:
ācāryera siddhānte mukundera haila santoṣa
bhaṭṭācāryera vākya mane haila duḥkha-roṣa

synonyms: ācāryera—of Gopīnātha Ācārya; siddhānte—with the conclusions; mukundera—of Mukunda Datta; haila—there was; santoṣa—satisfaction; bhaṭṭācāryera—of Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya; vākye—by the words; mane—in the mind; haila—there was; duḥkha—unhappiness; roṣa—and anger.
translation: Śrīla Mukunda Datta felt very satisfied to hear the conclusive statements of Gopīnātha Ācārya, but he became very unhappy and angry to hear the statements put forward by Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya.
